item.title: Oil Subdued as Investors Eye Economic Outlook
item.description: Oil futures edged higher in Europe, settling into a range following Saudi Arabia’s planned cuts, with prices being driven largely by investor sentiment, which is focused on economic worries, rather than supply and demand fundamentals..

item.title: Dollar Could Hold Onto Recent Gains After Surprise BOC Rate Rise
item.description: The dollar could hold onto its recent gains on speculation the Fed may follow the BOC with a rate rise next week, ING said, but added that traders should stay cautious ahead of Tuesday’s key U.S. inflation data.

item.title: Metals Mixed Amid Macro Uncertainty
item.description: Base and precious metals were mixed in early European trading, with ANZ Research saying economic headwinds continued to build, which will likely keep downward pressure on commodity markets in the short term.

item.title: Autoliv to Cut Around 11% of Workforce
item.description: Autoliv announced plans to lose up to 8,000 jobs globally as it accelerates its cost cuts and simplifies its logistics and geographic footprint, and said it expected to increase pricing to combat “extraordinary” inflation.

item.title: Logistics Companies' Hopes of Strong Peak Season Seem to Be Fading
item.description: Hopes of a strong peak season for logistics companies are fading with no sign of a rebound in freight demand across the air and sea segments so far, Citi said, citing recent meetings with a number of major players.

item.title: Buyers Could Emerge for German Bunds at Current Yield Levels
item.description: Front-end German bond yields are very close to last week’s highs and the 10-year Bund yield is also approaching the 2.5% level swiftly, likely luring buyers, Mizuho said.

item.title: Recycling and Regulation Are Hot Issues in Likely Update to U.S. Sustainable Marketing Guides
item.description: Nestlé and SC Johnson are at odds over whether the FTC should pursue stricter regulations as green claims rise.

item.title: Novartis's Sandoz Sets Out Post-Spinoff Growth Plan
item.description: Novartis’s generics unit Sandoz forecast product pipeline net sales of $3 billion over the next five years and a core earnings margin of 18%-19% this year, lower than previously forecast due to inflation and costs.

item.title: UK Housing Demand Improves
item.description: Demand for U.K. housing recovered on-month in May, with the RICS residential survey coming in at minus 18, the least negative figure for the past year, though forecasts of more interest rate rises are still likely to dampen positive trends.

item.title: India's RBI Holds Policy Rate Steady as Inflation Moderates
item.description: India’s central bank maintained its policy rate as domestic inflation has moderated

item.title: China's Lost Generation
item.description: Xi Jinping has a major youth unemployment problem on his hands.

item.title: Coinbase CEO Says He'll Challenge the SEC for 'Clarity' on Crypto
item.description: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong is in a battle with regulators after the SEC sued his company Tuesday. He sat down with The Wall Street Journal to discuss the situation, saying he is hoping the lawsuit will bring more clarity to the industry.

item.title: ​SEC's Gensler Had Crypto in His Sights for Years
item.description: Enforcement actions against crypto middlemen Binance and Coinbase could define the SEC chair’s legacy.

item.title: Amazon plans to launch an ad-supported tier of its Prime Video streaming service, according to people familiar with the situation.
item.description: Amazon plans to launch an ad-supported tier of its Prime Video streaming service, according to people familiar with the situation.

item.title: Investors are bracing for a flood of more than $1 trillion of Treasury bills in the wake of the debt-ceiling fight, potentially sparking a new bout of volatility in financial markets.
item.description: Investors are bracing for a flood of more than $1 trillion of Treasury bills in the wake of the debt-ceiling fight, potentially sparking a new bout of volatility in financial markets.

item.title: Instagram helps connect and promote a vast network of accounts openly devoted to the commission and purchase of underage-sex content, according to investigations by The Wall Street Journal and researchers at Stanford University and the University of Massachusetts Amherst.
item.description: Instagram helps connect and promote a vast network of accounts openly devoted to the commission and purchase of underage-sex content, according to investigations by The Wall Street Journal and researchers at Stanford University and the University of Massachusetts Amherst.

item.title: Pope Francis underwent intestinal surgery at a Rome hospital for treatment of a hernia, the Vatican said.
item.description: Pope Francis underwent intestinal surgery at a Rome hospital for treatment of a hernia, the Vatican said.

item.title: U.S. stocks ended mixed, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq shedding 0.4% and 1.3%, respectively, while the Dow gained 0.3%.
item.description: U.S. stocks ended mixed, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq shedding 0.4% and 1.3%, respectively, while the Dow gained 0.3%.

item.title: Pencejoined the 2024 Republican presidential nomination race and immediately questioned Trump's conservatism and leadership.
item.description: Pence joined the 2024 Republican presidential nomination race and immediately questioned Trump’s conservatism and leadership.

item.title: Americans imported more goods from abroad in April while becoming less reliant on products from China, another sign of strong U.S. economic momentum this spring.
item.description: Americans imported more goods from abroad in April while becoming less reliant on products from China, another sign of strong U.S. economic momentum this spring.
